content: Muscle weakness question. I’ve had no issues so far with muscle weakness. Yesterday and today my entire right thigh hurts, like a deep pain. I don’t want to create problems where there is none but everytime I have a weird symptom now I think it’s Neuropathy related. What does it feel like when it starts? I don’t feel weakness, just a deep ache in my thigh. Could also be im Hypersensitive to anything new happening and I just have a strained muscle.
Has anyone tried the Nerogenx treatment?
Anyone scratch an itch on your stomach and feel the neuropathy zap somewhere like your shoulder?Anyone scratch an itch on your stomach and feel the neuropathy zap somewhere like your shoulder?

So sitting here having a good day. My pins and needles in hands and feet were almost non existent today. BUT has anyone just gotten a random single pin prick. Feels like an invisible being that just taking a knitting needle and poking in one spot (like my cheek), then an hour later a single prick on my head, or on my ear. Anyone experience this. It’s random and so precise. No tingling all over just big single poke feeling in random spots at random times.

Have any of you had to take short term disability until you were able to get some pain relief? I posted a few days ago...I currently recovered from Covid (I was in the hospital), prior to Covid I was able to manage my neuropathy...NOW I can barely breathe the pain is SO BAD. I had a visit with my neurologist last Thursday he noticed a bump on my arm, I'm getting a biopsy next 2 weeks. I'm waiting for the pain management clinic to approve me. I work from home..but sitting at the computer kills me... since covid my left hand is twice the size of my right... I have this unbearable pain that just started in my arm..my fingers are starting to curl, when this happens I have no control of my hand.  The intense burning in my calves and feet are more than I can handle.  The neurologist poked my left foot with 3 different needles..I couldn't feel it at all.  I NEVER SLEEP I'm going crazy.  I have no quality of life.  Covid has really really taken a toll on my neuropathy and my neurologist said they are still trying to figure out options for this.  I'm so afraid of losing my job I was once the top sales rep of the company.. now im the lowest..I can't think straight..I'm in so much pain.  I've tried marijuana, edibles (never again), I'm on 2400 mg of gabapentin, lyrica, cymbalta NOTHING IS WORKING!!!! My dr mentioned looking into SSI but idk how that works in terms of pay, I make a good amount of money and I dont know if SSI if approved matches your current pay...does anyone know how that works? Thank you!
Can Throid effect Nerves?

Hi everyone! I joined this group because my dad has been diagnosed with peripheral neuropathy after having a heart attack and multiple strokes. He’s currently getting treatments (I’m not 100% sure what it’s called I’ll double check) he does 12 treatments total and he just finished his 5th. We still haven’t seen any improvements though. We’re just searching for anything at this point that’s helped others because his doctors don’t seem to care or help much. Right now he really struggles with walking and getting his feet aligned, they tend to get all twisted. He does walk with a walker but I’m still afraid he’s going to fall and hurt himself! Any advice, guidance, help.. etc is much appreciated!!
Has anyone ever passed out due to pain been doing a lot lately. I put my feet under pressure and I just go scare the crap out my wife. Really worries my wife. Waiting for referral for pain clinic.

This story starts with a Laminectomy in December.  Never recovered properly.  Covid made it impossible to  do PT at a prime time of healing.  Constant back pain.  Used kratom and Cannibus/CBD for pain with 800 mg ibuprofen every 6 hours until I had bilateral pitting edema in both ankles.  After lots of testing, cardiac clearance and kidney ultrasound they were stumped. Saw GI and they cleared me.   During all the testing started to develop what I called dead spots in my feet.  Hurt real bad. Thought it was my new stiff hiking shoes causing it.  Finally went to Dr. about the pain. He gave me Tramadol and Gabapentin (Lyrica caused 15 lb weight gain and a slew of side effects.  I took myself off it at 3 weeks).   Pain became intolerable in the feet and walking became very "animated".  PcP referred me to Pain Clinic bc tramadol and Gabapentin were not working for the pain. I was basically couchbound majority of the time. This all happened over abou a month.  Pain Dr asked if he could stick needles in my feet to measure nerve signals, after I hobbled into his office. I'm still thinking its spinal cord issue from surgery.  Next thing I know I'm diagnosed with peripheral neuropathy.    Doc gave me hydrocodone and Baclofen.  Within a few more weeks I'm to my current status of not being able to walk without pain meds.  Still barely getting around. Been grabbing walls to walk to bathroom about 6 weeks now.  Monday I'll see the neurologist finally.  Scared this is something else not that peripheral neuropathy is not bad enough.  Back hurts me constantly but nowhere near the foot/heel pain I have 24/7.  Had to go to ER bc now I think I've torn something in my left knee from not trying to put pressure on right heel for a week straight due to intolerable pain. On top of foot pain and back now I'm wearing a knee brace.  I take Hydrocodone, Baclofen, Gabapentin, CBD, Cannabis and Kratom and still cannot find relief.  I avoided opiates besides a 3 week period (back surgery) this whole time since surgery in December. My balance is terrible I fall backwards mostly but fall other ways too. If I close my eyes I cant standup but for a few seconds without falling. Was fired from my job since I have not worked since December.   Now I just wanna be able to continuing walking and keep what physical ability I have left.  I'm losing so much so fast. Started getting tingles in my hands last few days. What is happening to me?  I'm 38 years old. Have alcohol history. I quit besides a beer or 2 (literally) here or there and life was good.   I am afraid neuro will fixate on this and not the surgery which I am much worse off from. Maybe it's both.  Anyways I've been on here awhile now and thought I'd share my story. Apologies for the novel their are a lot of important details. Peace to you. Thank you for taking the time to read another's story.
Has anyone tried a product called neuroflo?
Anyone else try this I put it in my feet 10 minutes ago and the burning stopped for now anyways
If you are diabetic and have neuropathy, your insurance will most likely pay for one pair of shoes per year for you.  You would have to go to a podiatrist to order them.  In the USA.

In case noone saw my response in regards to my post last week about the red light therapy session that worked really well with the pain..REALLY WELL the day after..here is the link for the machine my therapist used. She said the machine is spendy but designed to stimulate the nervous system. The next day I felt great no pain..but you have to use this machine everyday.  I'm going to see if I can get my insurance to cover one.  My pain is back to  horrible again.

I have 5 months with diabetic neuropathy and it's horrible 😭 I can't stand anymore these horrible pains are hell in life my diabetes doctor gives me gabapentin and does not help me anything burn my feet itch I can no longer walk well someone knows that specialist I can go to treat this terrible disease I see and read everything you guys post and I know I'm not alone but this is not life ami I ended my life with this disease my girl is the one that encourages me to follow Because if not I don't know what I had done already 😭 · Rate this translation

Hello, new to this site. I was diagnosed with non-diabetic demyelinating poly neuropathy about 15 yrs ago. It has been a crazy ride! I switched to Paleo eating took myself off gaba, and statins. Since no processed foods, auger for 7 weeks now I wake up with energy and no brain fog. Had stem cell injections hoping it would help, feet are feeling better. There is no cure but we can cut down on inflammation by what we eat and drink, therefore there is some hope.

Tried to figure out what to do with a package of 10 hot dogs I got from the food pantry. They are not my favorite food. Found a recipe online for Hot Dpg curry, sautéing garlic and ginger with the hot dogs, then adding a spice mixture of curry powder, paprika, turmeric, and salt, and then finally finishing in a sauce made of tomato sauce, ketchup, and heavy cream. There is some sugar in the tomato sauce and ketchup, so it might not work for keto people, but it is low enough per serving to work with my diet.
